revision.text:
==Cross compile== Is it possible to compile Qt 64Bit on a 32Bit Windows? --[[Special:Contributions/92.79.131.147|92.79.131.147]] ([[User talk:92.79.131.147|talk]]) 15:08, 17 September 2010 (UTC)
• Yes, you just need to install and set-up the x64 compiler from Visual Studio, properly.
:You should take a look at: http://developer.qt.nokia.com/faq/answer/how_can_i_build_64_bit_qt_on_a_32_bit_system :this worked for me [[Special:Contributions/217.7.198.31|217.7.198.31]] ([[User talk:217.7.198.31|talk]]) 12:43, 24 November 2010 (UTC)

{{rfd-survived|page=Wikibooks:Requests for deletion/Guitar/Song Library}} I think your list is so good that I have taken this to the [http://de.wikibooks.org/wiki/Gitarre:_Auswahl_einiger_Lieder_mit_Akkorden German wikibooks]. If our list will be revised, then I add the supplements in your list. Greeting from Germany --[[User:Mjchael|Mjchael]] ([[User talk:Mjchael|talk]]) 15:40, 17 September 2010 (UTC) == Stars == I would recommend leaving out the grey stars as it looks like it's saying 1/3, meaning this page is a third finished, just one star would be better to mean easy, or just the words 'easy', 'int' and 'adv' might be clearer. - [[Special:Contributions/149.255.38.228|149.255.38.228]] ([[User talk:149.255.38.228|discuss]]) 15:57, 9 February 2012 (UTC) == I'm going to recommend that this page be deleted == I'm going to request a deletion of this page. It consist of external links - that is all it is. Wikibooks is not a directory for external links. There are millions of tabs out there and the list can be construed as endless. Cheers [[User:Sluffs|Sluffs]] ([[User talk:Sluffs|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Sluffs|contribs]]) 13:17, 17 August 2013 (UTC) :I object. This is a very useful page for novice guitarists whom are looking for one place to go to in order to easily access a large variety of simple chords to notable songs from all time. I agree that such a list can theoretically be endless (especially if at some time in the future hundreds of people would become involved in the expansion of the list), nevertheless, as the list would keep on growing we could re organize the content and split it into various pages (for example - a new division to the content based on the genre of songs). The best proof for how useful this page is for novice guitar players can be found in it's statistics page - as you can see [http://stats.grok.se/en.b/latest/Guitar/Guitar_Chords_Song_Library here], this page is the 33rd most watch page on Wikibooks! (it was watched 13,393 times in the last 30 days alone!). [[User:Kodos|Kodos]] ([[User talk:Kodos|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kodos|contribs]]) 14:33, 17 August 2013 (UTC) ::I've removed RFD tag + restored original lists, minus the external links, as a lot of time passed since RFD placement yet there wasn't anyone else besides Sluffs whom demanded the article be deleted, and as the alternative was actually much worse. I plan on improving the lists as much as I can in the near future. [[User:Kodos|Kodos]] ([[User talk:Kodos|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kodos|contribs]]) 17:27, 8 May 2014 (UTC) :::Meanwhile RFD tag re-added by user [[user:QuiteUnusual|QuiteUnusual]] [[User:Kodos|Kodos]] ([[User talk:Kodos|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kodos|contribs]]) 17:32, 8 May 2014 (UTC) There was no consensus at RFD. Please improve this list by referencing reliable sources to help maintain a [[WB:NPOV|neutral point of view]] and to help verify the factual accuracy of this list. --[[User:Darklama|dark]][[User_talk:Darklama|lama]] 18:04, 29 May 2014 (UTC)

revision.text: == September 2010 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|link=]] We welcome and appreciate [[Special:Contributions/75.192.36.75|your contributions]], but your recent edits to [[:Brave New World/Summary]] had to be undone. Please see [[Wikibooks:What is Wikibooks|What is Wikibooks?]] to learn more about what contributions are beneficial to Wikibooks. It might not have been your intention, but your recent edit removed content from Wikibooks. When removing text, please specify a reason in the edit summary and discuss edits that are likely to be controversial on the page's talk page. If this was a mistake, don't worry; the text has been restored, as you can see from the page history. Take a look at the [[Wikibooks:Welcome|welcome page]] to learn more about contributing to this project, and if you would like to experiment, please use the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]]. Thank you.<!-- please help --> – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] <small>[[User talk:Adrignola|talk]]</small> 16:52, 17 September 2010 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, GoRight!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' about the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything, and changes can be made easily. Come [[Wikibooks:Reading room/General|introduce yourself]] to everyone, and let us know what [[Wikibooks:Reading room/Projects|interests you]]. If you're coming here from other Wikimedia projects, you should read [[Help:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|our primer for Wikimedians]] to get quickly up-to-speed.
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=]] '''Getting help'''
* See the '''Wikibooks [[Help:Contents|help pages]]''' for common issues, or read [[Using Wikibooks]] for a more user-friendly introduction to the project. * Remember, every edit is saved, so if you make mistakes, you can [[Wikibooks:Reverting|revert]] to an earlier version if needed. * Get help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Files must be uploaded to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]], unless they are copyrighted and need to be uploaded here under [[w:fair use|fair use]]. If you need to upload a [[Wikibooks:MEDIA#Non-free use|non-free]] file, you may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to do so. Please be sure to provide the required {{tl|information}}: a [[WB:FILES|license tag]] and source are always required; non-free files require a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}}.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[:w:Help:Edit summary|the edit summary]] and [[Help:Show preview|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[Help:Talk page|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - pages should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only becomes available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
Thanks. – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] 17:01, 17 September 2010 (UTC)
(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
== Welcome, GoRight! == Congratulations. I think you will find the smaller wikis a vast improvement in sense of community and general helpfulness, over en.wikipedia. Just remember to be nice! Wikibooks has some special rules; a simple summary is that Wikibooks is intended for textbooks, and original research isn't allowed. But some kinds of original writing are allowed. However, Wikiversity, which is historically and practically connected with Wikibooks, is very clear that you can present original research, and you can opt out of NPOV on pages. If you proceed slowly, you will be, I'm sure, helped should you cross some boundary. One rule I encourage you to follow: don't import disputes here from other wikis. If you run into a user you had problems with elsewhere, avoid assuming you will have problems with that person here. Don't accuse people here of misbehavior based on what they did there. And should someone follow you here with accusations, step aside. Don't fall for the temptation to respond intemperately. You will find admins on these smaller wikis are generally not inclined to jump for blocks. The small wikis need users, they don't want to drive them away! En.wikipedia, this isn't. Respect the community here, and it will respect you. It is not uncommon for users banned from Wikipedia to become sysops on the other wikis. It kinda changes one's attitude. --[[User:Abd|Abd]] ([[User talk:Abd|talk]]) 04:32, 18 September 2010 (UTC)

revision.comment: Created page with '== Sales performance (alpha = 0.88/0.92) == === Items === *Contributing to your company's gaining significant market share. *Generating a high level of sales. *Quickly generatin...'
revision.text:
== Sales performance (alpha = 0.88/0.92) == === Items ===
*Contributing to your company's gaining significant market share. *Generating a high level of sales. *Quickly generating sales from the new product. *Identifying major accounts and selling to them. *Exceeding sales targets. *Assisting your sales supervisor in achieving his/her objectives.
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Previously used by Sujan et al. (1994).
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Output control (alpha = 0.76/0.87) == === Items === *My pay increases and other tangible rewards depend on how my performance compares with goals. *If my performance goals ar...'
revision.text:
== Output control (alpha = 0.76/0.87) == === Items ===
*My pay increases and other tangible rewards depend on how my performance compares with goals. *If my performance goals are not met, I will be asked to explain why. *Performance evaluations of salespeople place primary weight on results. *My pay increases and other tangible rewards depend on the degree to which I achieve specific goals set. *My immediate supervisor monitors the extent to which I achieve my performance goals.
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Adapted from Jaworski/MacInnis (1989).
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: RV, no need to add the same comment to so many pages
revision.text:
== Supervisee trust (alpha = 0.88/0.87) == === Items ===
*My supervisor and I have a sharing relationship; we freely share our ideas, feelings, and hopes about the work we do. *I can freely talk to him/her about difficulties I am having at work and know that he/she wants to listen. *If I share my problems with my supervisor, I know he/she would respond constructively and caringly. *We both would feel a sense of loss if we could no longer work together. *I would have to say, my supervisor and I have made considerable emotional investments in our working relationship.
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Previously used by McAllister (1995).
=== Related Scales ===
*[[Handbook of Management Scales/Distrust of others|Distrust of others]] *[[Handbook of Management Scales/Trust|Trust]]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Supervisor accessibility (alpha = 0.84/0.89) == === Items === *My supervisor is available to meet with me. *My supervisor spends time with me. *My supervisor makes joint sale...'
revision.text:
== Supervisor accessibility (alpha = 0.84/0.89) == === Items ===
*My supervisor is available to meet with me. *My supervisor spends time with me. *My supervisor makes joint sales calls with me. *My supervisor observes my performance in the field.
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Adapted from Oliver/Anderson (1994).
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Achievement orientation (alpha = 0.84/0.78) == === Items === *My supervisor shows that he/she has confidence in my ability to meet most objectives. *My supervisor lets me kno...'
revision.text:
== Achievement orientation (alpha = 0.84/0.78) == === Items ===
*My supervisor shows that he/she has confidence in my ability to meet most objectives. *My supervisor lets me know he/she expects me to perform at my highest level. *My supervisor consistently sets challenging goals for me to attain. *My supervisor encourages continual improvement in my performance.
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Adapted from Oliver/Anderson (1994).
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Role ambiguity (alpha = 0.93/0.87) == === Items === *I am not sure how much service I should provide to customers. *I am not sure which specific company strengths I should pr...'
revision.text:
== Role ambiguity (alpha = 0.93/0.87) == === Items ===
*I am not sure how much service I should provide to customers. *I am not sure which specific company strengths I should present. *I am not sure which product benefits I should highlight to customers. *I am not sure how I am expected to handle customer objections. *I am not sure how I am expected to handle unusual customer problems and situations. *I am not sure how I am expected to interact with customers.
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Previously used by Singh/Rhoads (1991).
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Product complexity (alpha = 0.81/0.82) == === Items === *Simple/unsophisticated--sophisticated *Nontechnical--highly technical *Low engineering content--high engineering cont...'
revision.text:
== Product complexity (alpha = 0.81/0.82) == === Items ===
*Simple/unsophisticated--sophisticated *Nontechnical--highly technical *Low engineering content--high engineering content
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Previously used by Bello/Gilliland (1997).
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Competitive intensity (alpha = 0.88/0.78) == === Description === The authors examined the validity of the measure in a two-step approach recommended by Anderson and Gerbing (...'
revision.text:
== Competitive intensity (alpha = 0.88/0.78) == === Description ===
The authors examined the validity of the measure in a two-step approach recommended by Anderson and Gerbing (1988).
=== Items ===
*Few--many competitors *Weak--strong competition *Few--many competing products
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.]
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Created page with '== Market volatility (alpha = 0.73/0.82) == === Items === *Stable--unstable *Certain--uncertain *Changes slowly--changes rapidly *Predictable--unpredictable === Source === *[h...'
revision.text:
== Market volatility (alpha = 0.73/0.82) == === Items ===
*Stable--unstable *Certain--uncertain *Changes slowly--changes rapidly *Predictable--unpredictable
=== Source ===
*[http://www.jstor.org/pss/3203455 Atuahene-Gima/Li (2002): When does trust matter? Antecedents and contingent effects of supervisee trust on performance in selling new products in China and the United States. Journal of Marketing, Vol. 66, No. 3, pp. 61-81.] Adapted from Bello/Gilliland (1997).
{{BookCat}}

The "Pattern" column labels the verbs according to Bescherelle's system.

revision.comment: Protected "[[Template:Infobox user]]": High-impact page: intended for wide use on user pages ([edit=autoconfirmed] (indefinite) [move=autoconfirmed] (indefinite))

revision.text: == September 2010 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|link=]] We welcome and appreciate [[Special:Contributions/HamedAmin|your contributions]], but some of your recent edits had to be undone. Please see [[Wikibooks:What is Wikibooks|What is Wikibooks?]] to learn more about what contributions are beneficial to Wikibooks. A page you recently created may not conform to some of Wikibooks' [[Wikibooks:Policies and guidelines|guidelines]] for new pages, so it will shortly be [[Wikibooks:Deletion policy|removed]] (if it hasn't been already). Please use the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]] for any tests. For more information about creating books, you may want to read [[Using Wikibooks]]. Thank you.<!-- please help --> <font color="#E66C2C">[[User:QuiteUnusual|'''QU''']]</font> <sup><font color="#306754">[[User talk:QuiteUnusual|TalkQu]]</font></sup> 22:26, 17 September 2010 (UTC)

revision.comment: Please use the sandbox to test.
revision.text: == September 2010 == [[File:Information.svg|25px|link=]] We welcome and appreciate [[Special:Contributions/Cwats124|your contributions]], but some of your recent edits had to be undone. Please see [[Wikibooks:What is Wikibooks|What is Wikibooks?]] to learn more about what contributions are beneficial to Wikibooks. Please take a look at the [[Wikibooks:Welcome|welcome page]] to learn more about contributing to this project. If you would like to experiment further, please use the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]] instead. Thank you.<!-- please help --> – [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] <small>[[User talk:Adrignola|talk]]</small> 22:29, 17 September 2010 (UTC)
